Key Match Events: Travis Head hit 137 as Australia chased down 241 in the final against India
Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma threatened to push Australia on the back-foot in an early partnership
Shubman Gill mistimed a shot and was caught by Travis Head
KL Rahul and Virat Kohli had a bizarre 4th wicket partnership producing 67 runs without a boundary in 19 overs
Pre-Game Insights: India had won 10 successive matches before losing the 2023 World Cup final
Australian captain Pat Cummins won the toss and chose to bowl
Rohit Sharma smashed a rapid 47 while Shubman Gill, Shreyas Iyer and Suryakumar Yadav failed to have any kind of impact
KL Rahul hit only one four in a 107-ball 66 while Virat Kohli, who scored 54, took his foot off the accelerator in a strange partnership with Rahul
Post-Match Reflections: India's batters, who were in stunning form, failed to put up a fight
Australia's batters were ultra-aggressive and their chase was clinical
Australia won the World Cup trophy for the 6th time in history
India's body language on the field was poor and the fielding was shoddy
Miscellaneous Highlights: Travis Head became the 7th batter to score a hundred in a World Cup final and the third opener to hit a fifty and a hundred in the semifinal and final of a men's ODI World Cup
Australia had won their first World Cup in 1987 and then followed it up with three successive titles in 1999, 2003 and 2007
Australia lost their first two matches to India and South Africa but since then won 9 successive matches to complete one of their most memorable World Cup campaigns
Others: Australia defeated India by 6 wickets to win their 6th ODI World Cup
India's batters were in stunning form but failed to capitalize in the final
Australia captain Pat Cummins won the toss and chose to bowl
The pitch was slow but by no means a bad cricket surface
